Text: Dr. Ahn, Sang-u is here.
My goodness. Sang-u is here.
Sang-u, say hello to the doctor.
All right. There you go.
Sang-u, you came with a shark today.
Should I take a look at what's inside the shark's mouth?
Oh, no.
Sang-u, why are you crying?
The doctor is going to ease your stomachache.
He's trying to ease your stomachache. Why are you crying?
Don't cry now.
If you keep crying,
this scary doctor is going to scold you and give you a shot.
Right, doctor?
Bad boy! Where's the syringe?
Nurse, where is the big syringe Sang-u is going to get?
Sang-u, be quiet. Stop crying.
If you keep crying, the doctor is going to bring a big syringe.
Stop.
Let's see. I have some snacks for Sang-u right here.
Oh, my goodness. Who scared Sang-u?
Who scared my sweet boy, Sang-u?
Was it the doctor?
It was the doctor, right?
I'll scold him for you.
There.
I scolded a bad doctor for you.
Doctor, why did you scare Sang-u?
He's such a nice boy.
Doctor, you won't scare Sang-u anymore, right?
Right, doctor?
I am sorry, Sang-u.
I'll give you this snack instead of a shot.
Eat this when you're all better.
-Yes. -Professor Ahn.
Ji-su needs her PEG tube changed now.
-Excuse me for a second, Sang-u. -Yes.
Hello.
I took a look at your ultrasound.
It will be difficult to treat with antibiotics.
What does he have exactly?
He has infective endocarditis.
There's an infection in his endocardium.
If we treat it with antibiotics, you may suffer from embolism.
I'm concerned an infected mass might block your vessels.
You must get surgery as soon as possible. Did you find him a bed?
Yes, he can get checked in after 6 p.m.
Check in today and let's book the surgery as soon as we can.
-Is it serious? -Yes.
If the infected mass is small,
antibiotics can be used to break it down.
From your ultrasound, the infected mass is big and dangling.
We can't tell when it will fall off.
If it goes to the brain, it causes a stroke.
If it goes to the heart, it causes a heart attack.
You need to have surgery soon.
Do we have an opening for surgery in two or three days?
No, we're full. There's no opening this week.
We'll do it in the morning if we must. Call Anesthesiology
and ask them to help me with the surgery in two or three days.
Okay.
Doctor, my daughter is getting married in three days.
Can we postpone the surgery until next week?
No, we cannot.
It's only for a couple of days.
-Wouldn't that be okay? -No.
Only if you want to end your life.
Dad, what are you talking about? Don't be foolish.
My wedding isn't what's important now.
You can look at the wedding photos.
Ask her to take lots of photos.
Then I'll see you tomorrow during my rounds.
Let me go over what you need to do.
First, head to the left and have your blood sample drawn.
Why is that doctor so rude?
I am sorry. We are well aware of that.
Second, get an EKG from the room
right next to where you have your blood sample drawn.
-And third... -Well...
Aged 78. His name is Im Gi-yeong.
He underwent coiling a month ago due to an SAH.
He showed symptoms of leg weakness and dementia three days ago
so he was readmitted.
His CT scan revealed that he has hydrocephalus.
It seems the IVH that was accompanied by SAH is gone for now.
EVD...
That's not it. I'm sorry.
I think we should perform a VP shunt.
Shouldn't you have that memorized by now?
You're right.
-Are you sure he needs a VP shunt? -Yes.
No.
-Is he wrong? -Yes, I think so.
Really? I think he's right.
You have until my next round.
Prepare a summary of relevant papers and surgical cases.
Okay.
-You, too. -Okay.
Professor Chae, have you had lunch yet?
We got a new restaurant to deliver to us.
-Which one? -A seafood stew restaurant.
That's too much for delivery food.
They also do a wonderful haemulpajeon.
Join us. We'll set it up in the office.
Go ahead without me. I'll eat with the guys.
The guys?
GONGNYONG RIDGE
SONG-HWA: LUNCH? SEOK-HYEONG: OKAY
GIVE ME A MINUTE
IT'S THE MOST IMPORTANT MOMENT OF MY LIFE
Gyeo-ul, residents rarely get to see a mesocaval shunt in person.
-What are you doing? -I told you not to talk.
-Get out of here. -Let's play fair.
-What are you doing? -Don't do anything.
-Should I start talking, too? -Well...
-I decided-- -It's seafood stew.
-I'm allergic to-- -Song-hwa wants seafood stew.
We're waiting for Gyeo-ul so you come here and be quiet.
Gyeo-ul?
It's all right. There's no pressure.
Take your pick.
-Of course. -We understand.
-We're all fine. -We understand everything.
Then...
I choose HPD.
-Come on! -My gosh.
Come on. A hemicolectomy is a great choice, too.
-My gosh. -Darn it.
The guardians must be here too.
-Goodness. -I mean... Why is it you again?
Let's go. Song-hwa ordered some big-eyed herring too.
And Jun-wan?
He's in PICU now. I guess he won't be joining us.
YULJE MEDICAL CENTER
What's Hui-dong's weight today?
It's three kilograms.
I can close him up now. Let's get ready.
Where's Jae-hak?
He went out to get the med students earlier.
Right. I guess he's more suited to that.
Let's get started.
CS has a lot of emergency surgeries. And our cases are the most dramatic.
Someone who was fine in the morning
could be dead by the afternoon in CS.
Do you know who the best cardiothoracic surgeon is?
Ji Sung.
-Who? -Ji Sung from New Heart.
I've watched medical dramas since I was ten.
Not him.
Teacher Kim from Dr. Romantic?
Were your names Cheol and Mi-ae?
-We're Hong-do and Yun-bok. -Hong-do and Yun-bok.
Guys, listen up.
Great doctors like them don't exist at this hospital.
There's only Thanos here.
You'll meet him soon.
-Yes, sir. -Where are you now?
I'm on my way.
-Will they perform the surgery here? -Yes.
It's more dangerous to move the patient to an OR with that many drips.
Are you Gyeon-u and Jik-nyeo?
We're Hong-do and Yun-bok.
-Third year in med school? -Yes.
-Pay attention. -Okay.
Professor,
-is this surgery difficult? -The baby will live, right?
Four days ago, he had a TGA, transposition of the great arteries.
His heart swelling was too severe. I couldn't close him up.
Seeing his heart today, I might be able to close him. So, I'll do it now.
He will live, right?
I'm closing him up because he's doing better.
Jae-hak, bring them in.
Pardon?
I see. Okay.
What do you think you're doing? You'll contaminate him.
Do you have a death wish?
He means the guardians.
Sir, Chan-hyeong has a slight fever.
Since when?
When I checked at 8 a.m., it was 36°C.
I checked again just now and it's 38.3°C. His nose is a little runny, too.
-Can we perform the surgery today? -Let me see him.
His lung doesn't sound good, either. We can't operate on him like this.
Give me five minutes. Remove the membrane for me.
Can I touch the baby?
-I disinfected my hands. -Okay.
What's wrong with this baby?
Jae-hak, get Chan-hyeong's guardians now.
He has Tetralogy of Fallot. It's a congenital heart defect.
He has a ventricular septal defect, pulmonary stenosis,
right ventricular hypertrophy, and overriding aorta, all together.
We were scheduled to operate this afternoon.
His oxygen saturation is a little low, though.
He's showing symptoms of pneumonia.
He needs this surgery as soon as possible.
They are here.
I have bad news.
We need to postpone the surgery by a day or two.
He has a fever and his lung doesn't sound good.
I plan to reschedule after taking an X-ray of his lungs.
He's still finding it hard to breathe.
He might be in more pain if we rush into surgery.
We'll do that, then.
If it's a mild case of pneumonia, he'll recover in two to three days.
We'll observe him for a few days.
Do you have any questions?
No.
You'll reschedule the surgery and let us know, right?
We know. You explained already.
Okay, then.
My gosh, they seem so composed. Their son's life is at stake.
They are just immature. Did you see how young his mother is?
She was born in 2000.
I like that she's calm.
Do you think it's possible that she's not herself right now
because of the pressure she's under and she needs to escape from reality?
She's still very young.
Maybe she's having trouble coming to terms with her situation.
-Jae-hak. -Yes?
Why do you talk so much?
Mind your own business.
Okay.
Let's get going.
Hey, little baby.
Don't be sick.
YULJE MEDICAL CENTER
I feel dizzy.
-It's Ik-jun's favorite song. -It's my favorite song.
-No, it's my song. -If you lie down after eating,
you'll get reflux esophagitis.
Song-hwa. Did your eyes get worse?
We had the same eyesight but now I can't see.
Try removing your contacts.
What's taking Jun-wan so long?
Guys, I haven't told you this yet,
but I sing this song really well.
I kept quiet until now because of the fuss you guys make.
Do you want to go to a karaoke? Is that it?
What do you say? Should we go tonight? Oh, good.
-Anything for me? -Of course. Come, sit down.
-That was quick. -Yes.
It was a delayed sternal closure. Do you have ketchup?
You have all sorts of stuff.
It came with the food.
Please, stop wiping the table. You should see a shrink.
If I don't, there will be flies.
Put that down before I smack you.
Hey.
-Did you guys know? -What?
What?
I can sing this song really well.
Isn't this "Aloha" by Cool?
I made a lot of girls cry with this song.
Right. In Hawaii.
-This is good. -Hawaii?
-Don't. -What about it?
-What? -What?
-Something happened in Hawaii, right? -You bet.
Hey, he...
He was in Hawaii for a month after his medical board exam.
Stop moving about.
-Ouch. -You're all over the place.
He's been famous for that since high school.
He was friends with everyone in ten different classes.
He was noisy, easily distracted and moved about constantly.
I don't know how he always got the top grades in school.
That's what kids today call being "on fleek."
And he's "unfleek."
I'm trying to listen to the song.
You annoying prick.
Did you pick Professor Lee's surgery again?
-Yes. -Gyeo-ul.
Do you like Professor Lee?
Yes.
I like Professor Lee.
He has a kid.
So what?
Nothing.
Have we ever performed "Aloha"?
No, we have not. We never performed a show.
At least, we had a conscience.
Hey, do you remember?
We practiced all night to perform a show with this song.
But that jerk registered our band as a comedy team.
And that jerk told us on the day of the festival.
He said we weren't on the poster because we were a secret weapon.
Gosh, that idiot.
He's lucky he's a doctor. Otherwise, he'd be a fraud.
Our band was closer to a comedy than a music show.
I saved you guys from getting beaten up by the audience.
-Come on. -But still,
we improved a lot in three to four years.
We did well given our situation.
Besides, you guys were scared.
When you found out about the show, your hands shook for a week.
-I thought he had hand tremors. -Gosh.
I was worried he might not be able to finish his internship
-with those shaky hands. -Stop making stories up.
Did we suck that bad? I thought we were pretty good.
Performing on stage is a different matter altogether.
It was like Gag Concert.
Ik-jun got so mad while he tried to teach you to play the bass guitar.
Damn it. I'm still angry about that.
Hey, I wasn't that bad.
Besides... He's good but he was a terrible teacher.
Even so, I like Ik-jun's voice.
There you go. Good one.
I'll sing for you guys today.
Let's go to karaoke after work.
If we had time to go to karaoke, we wouldn't be here eating seafood stew.
I have VSD surgery.
I have a conference with the PED tonight.
I'm grocery shopping with Mom.
What about this weekend?
I'm golfing with the director and chairman.
-A half-marathon. It's been a while. -I'm going camping.
I'm getting my nails done with Mom.
Fine, we won't go.
You guys are ridiculous.
Do you think I've got nothing better to do than go to karaoke with you?
I'm busy, too.
I need to watch a movie and do some coloring with U-ju.
We need to eat loach soup, too.
I won't go. I'm not going! Gosh.
-He'll probably go, right? -One hundred percent.
SU KARAOKE
-Guess where we are, U-ju. -Is that a nightclub?
-Who taught you that word? -Aunt did.
Aunt Terminator told me
that you lived at a place called nightclub a long time ago.
Nightclub Rat.
That's true.
Your dad used to live in an apartment named "Nightclub."
But this isn't that apartment.
This place is... You know that I'm in a band, right?
Like in Super Wings, I sing, dance, and put on shows.
I'm just like them.
And this is the first place I ever performed.
You could say that I spent my youth here.
U-ju.
Suddenly...
I feel a bit overwhelmed.
Dad. Please buy me one more corn dog.
The corn dog... Have you finished that already?
Yes.
Okay. Let's go before the stall closes. All right.
-Is the corn dog that good? -Yes.
Hey, U-ju.
You only say "please" when you want something from me.
No, that's not true. That's news to me.
What? Where did you learn that?
-Mom. -My gosh.
I stayed up all night
Seeing you smile makes me happy
Even if you're just joking
Hey.
Sorry. I was trying to reserve a song, but I ended up canceling it.
-Liar. -That's right. I lied.
Hey, wake up.
What's wrong with him?
He took three calming pills this morning.
Because of the show?
Seok-hyeong is a hermit and a sociophobe, who lives in isolation.
-My gosh, what was the last one? -A coward.
Yes. With that, he was known as the Grand Slammer.
Hey, it's my turn!
I requested something. Give me a second.
Listen. It should be me, Seok-hyeong,
Ik-jun, Jun-wan, then Song-hwa. So it's my turn to sing.
Are you actually keeping count? Are you some kind of a pervert?
Where's Ik-jun?
We're here because of him.
My goodness. What is this song?
"ALOHA" BY COOL
-Did you pick this song? -No, I didn't.
Then, who did?
A candle in the dark
A wineglass filled with our promise
I will always stay by your side And protect you
After all, you believed in me
I'll ask only one thing from you
I'm dreaming To be eternally happy with you
It doesn't have to be fancy I don't need a perfect life
The only thing I want is you
Don't worry
Always
I will always remember this moment
In my arms
Sit down, guys.
Don't get too excited. Sit down.
I will make sure Your smile lights up forever
I am not saying this because I am happy
To spend our first night together
I will not change
I will only have eyes for you
Even if I lose everything
I won't regret this
I will always love you
With my everlasting love for you
"From this moment on,
the most important person in my life isn't me but you.
I cannot show my determination with words,
but I love only you.
-Like friends -You said he was shy.
-or like couples, -Too much medication.
until my last breath, I will only love you."
As we believe we are of one
And as we always trust one another
-Stay on beat. -I hope we will comfort each other
In misery and celebrate
-Happiness together -Hey, slowly.
I promise you
When things get hard
I'll be your protector
When you smile in my arms
I will make sure
Your smile lights up forever
I am not saying this because I am happy
To spend our first night together
I will not change
I will only have eyes for you
Even if I lose everything
I won't regret this
I will always love you
With my everlasting love for you
-At seven o'clock, let's meet up! -Let's meet up!
Hello, this is Lee Soo-geun.
Hey, Ji-won, say hello.
Hello. I'm Ji-won.
Ji-won, I looked at the calendar for May today.
I noticed there are so many holidays in May.
-There's a holiday for you, too. -Children's Day!
That's right. There's Children's Day and there's Parents' Day.
And Teachers' Day as well! There are so many!
Are you trying to sell something?
We're discussing holidays. You sound like a street peddler.
But there's one thing that disappoints me. There's no holiday for myself.
Come on, Soo-geun. You do whatever you want every day.
-What do you mean? -Every single day.
What if you could do only the things you want to do for one day?
How about we try to live today like that?
May is the perfect month for that.
Here's our first song. It's a song by Cool. It's in English.
Ji-won.
Over here!
One, two.
-Let's do this! -Let's go!
-Good luck. -Let's complete the run!
You have one minute before we start!
I try to get rid of your scent in the wind
Get going, it doesn't matter where
Hello, sir. I'm here.
You can park your car in B-104. It's empty now.
Okay. Thank you.
Good luck with your records!
Five, four, three, two, one.
Shouldn't we send him to a mental hospital or something?
-You are right. -Goodness.
HYEON-HO MIGHT HAVE SURGICAL BLEEDING. ELEVATED LACTIC ACID LEVEL, NO URINE
RESIDENT YONG SEOK-MIN
YEONINSAN CAMPSITE, B-104
Look at that.
He's good.
Isn't it hard to handle VIP patients on top of your regular patients?
No, it's doable. There are other doctors, too.
It's nice to see a young doctor like you.
I envy your friendship, too.
Jong-su, the tenth hole is too far.
Let's take the cart.
He's my cousin.
-That's supposed to be a secret. -Everyone knows.
-Everyone at the hospital knows. -No.
Not everyone knows.
Hey, you know what?
People know even the things you assume they have no idea about.
Hey, I'm tired too. Let's take the cart.
-Let's just walk. -Take the cart.
Let's walk.
Are you upset?
How much did you prescribe?
What about the IO?
Okay. I'll be there soon.
Thank you.
-You and me. -A scamming phone call.
"Sir, I need you to go to an ATM right now."
Professor Yang. What a surprise to see you here.
I thought you weren't eating.
My schedule suddenly freed up.
I see.
-Professor Yang, why didn't you tell us? -Yes?
About what?
You were in a comedy club during pre-med.
I was so surprised. I didn't see it coming.
I thought you were a loner, but you're pretty cool.
No, I wasn't. Who said that?
Dr. Jang told us.
Dr. Jang Gyeo-ul who is a third-year GS resident.
Hello.
Dr. Jang. It's true, isn't it?
You said those five professors who were born in 1980 were in a comedy club.
-That's what I heard, too. -From whom?
Professor Lee Ik-jun of Hepatopancreatic Surgery.
I see.
Weren't you in the middle of your meal?
Try some bread. It's really good.
Okay. Dig in.
Professor Yang, we'd love to have a meal with you.
I hear Dr. Jang buys them beef.
Sure. Eat up. I'll treat you to beef some other time.
Right?
My gosh. I should get going.
I just got a text message that they have the result of the MRI I requested.
Bye, then.
-Okay. -Okay.
-Bye. -Bye.
-Have a good day. -Okay.
Goodness. Bye.
Tae-in, did you get any MRI requests from ob-gyn today?
No, there's none. I just checked before I came down here.
Gosh, what is with him?
How does he get along with other people?
Professor Yang is good at what he does, though.
He's not authoritative, and he always does his work.
-I like him. -Is that how things work in America?
I heard he did his fellowship in the States.
Is it the merit of individualism?
Tell me how that's considered merit.
He's just a frustrating sloth.
I just wish he would talk at least.
I can never read what he's thinking.
Dr. Jang, who's that? Your boyfriend?
-Even his photo makes you that happy? -Yes, it does.
-Yes. It does make me happy. -My gosh.
I'll get going now.
An ambulance brought her in due to a severe stomachache.
According to the X-ray scan, it could be an ileus.
We called you because she had a liver transplant before.
She released gas and had diarrhea while waiting.
Good work. Can you bend your knees for me?
I'm sorry, doctor. It's the weekend.
Gyu-bin, you know I'm always on call. Give me a second.
You had diarrhea and released gas, right?
Yes. But it doesn't hurt at all now.
I thought I was going to die in the ambulance.
As soon as I saw your face, the pain disappeared completely.
-I'm really sorry. -It's okay. You're recovering.
But Gyu-bin, I'm really sorry about the scar.
That's nothing. I'm just glad to be back in school.
Goodness.
Can I take a scan quickly?
-Yes. -Okay.
I knew it. See?
I knew you would be here. Is this the golf course?
Jeez. Take a look at this.
What is it? I don't have much time.
I've had revision surgery. They're closing up now, so I need to get back.
It won't take long.
This teenage patient had an LDLT.
It's not as visible with steroids,
but the hypertrophy on the vertical scar is a bit too noticeable.
Can you refer this case to a scar clinic?
Sure.
Send her to my department. I'll take a look.
My gosh.
Ik-sun also has biliary atresia.
She still has a big scar on her stomach from Kasai's operation.
Ik-sun's still alive?
What? Why would she be dead?
Wasn't that your dog's name?
-That's Micky. -Micky is your sister.
-My sister is Ik-sun. -That's your dog.
My dog's name is Ik-sun.
No, my dog's name is Micky. Micky is Ik-sun.
Damn it. You confused me.
My younger sister's name is Ik-sun.
Hey, what is this?
This is a recommendation letter for priests.
Right?
-It's for real this time, right? -Yes.
I feel bad for Jeong-won's mother.
Same. That jerk.
-Is it Jeong-won? -No, it's my wife.
Your wife? You have a wife?
Yes, I have a wife.
The ambitious Ms. Yuk Hye-jeong?
She's so busy, I'll forget her face pretty soon.
That's enough.
Hey, honey. It's been so long!
What time is it over there?
Okay.
Is your marathon course here?
-Tell me which hole this room counts as. -Yes.
-It's his wife. -Okay.
-Really? -Okay. Sure.
Okay. I'll see you tomorrow.
She's coming back tomorrow.
She's coming straight to the hospital because she misses me.
It's because it's Children's Day in two days.
-Has it been a year since you saw her? -A year and a half.
She should've been here for her mom's anniversary at least.
Whatever! That's not my business.
Gosh, Yuk Hye-jeong.
She's my friend and I was the one who set him up with her.
I have never seen anyone who is as ambitious as she is.
I've never seen you badmouth anyone either.
Stop it. She's my wife. And she's U-ju's mother.
The virgin and the bachelor should shut it.
That's such an outdated term. A "bachelor."
Hey, Jeong-won. What is this?
Are you really going to quit to become a priest?
-Did you RSVP? -Is that important right now?
Listen. If you...
Hey, Gyeo-ul.
Of course. I collected a lot of those. Yes.
-Okay. I got it. -When is it?
-Did you talk to the director? -Okay.
I'll tell him next week.
I won't be leaving right away.
I'll stay until the end of the year and resign then.
I'm going to go see Gyeo-ul.
Seriously. Wait.
Look over here. Look at the camera.
One, two, three.
-What was that? -What are you doing?
Jeong-won will leave us soon. We should leave lots of photos behind.
-Bye. -What the...
Is he having an affair with Gyeo-ul?
Don't you have a photo of him alone?
Give me some time. I'm waiting for the right time.
But Jeong-won catches on really fast.
Did you ask him about me? What does he think of me?
-Not yet. -Why not?
It'd be too obvious. Is that okay?
Yes. I don't mind.
So, please ask him what he thinks of me.
Why don't you tell him you like him then?
That's too...
-I'm too shy to do that. -Gosh.
-But you're not shy talking to me? -No.
Okay, fine. I'll be extra sneaky
and ask him what he thinks of you.
I'm doing this because I think highly of your courage.
This is yukjeon. It's from Gwangju.
Oh, my. Are you serious? Yukjeon?
Why do you like Jeong-won so much?
Everything.
Do you need water?
I'm fine.
Gyeo-ul.
I think you have this fantasy about Jeong-won.
The way he treats people at the hospital
and the way he behaves around us are very different.
What is he like? I want to hear everything.
He's so sensitive.
He loses sleep for a month if something goes wrong with his patient.
He's so humanitarian.
And he's extremely stubborn.
He is a man of principles.
And he's not rich. He's dirt poor.
He mooches off Jun-wan.
Isn't that noblesse oblige?
Are we playing a game of antonyms?
What else? Tell me everything.
Most importantly, he...
Gosh.
Dating...
No. He's not interested in women.
I have never seen him with a girl, ever.
This is for your ears only.
Jeong-won is interested in something else.
Is he a sexual minority?
Jeez. Not like that. I mean he wants to be a man of God.
Not pride. A priest.
I doubt that.
I hope so, too.
I know that Professor Ahn is a devout Catholic.
All his brothers are priests, and his sisters are nuns.
But he's not a priest yet.
He just wants to be one.
Then I still have a chance.
Ik-jun, give me a cigarette.
Not with Gyeo-ul of all people.
You prick, you'd better come to your senses before I beat you up.
What are you thinking? You're married.
What?
What do you think of Gyeo-ul?
-What? -What do you think of her?
YULJE MEDICAL CENTER
SURGERY STATUS, IN WAITING
Hey.
Dad just came down.
Before we move you to the OR, let me check a few things.
-What's your name? -It's Jeong Su-beom.
Let me check your ID bracelet.
You are here today to be operated on by Professor Kim Jun-wan
of Cardiothoracic Surgery?
Yes.
Dad. Be strong in there, okay?
Everything will be fine. Don't worry.
My sweetheart.
I am sorry.
I can't come to your wedding because I am sick.
I am so sorry, sweetie.
Why are you sorry? I am sorry, Dad.
How could I get married when you're sick?
I'm sorry.
